_comment: Mixed Format Example - Demonstrates all three command formats in one file
_execution_flow: 4. background-service starts and runs in background
5. seqr keeps running to maintain background-service

_format_guide.description: You can mix different command formats in the same queue file
_format_guide.recommendation: Choose the format that makes each command most readable

when_to_use_each.array_format: Commands with multiple arguments or spaces in arguments
when_to_use_each.object_format: When you want maximum clarity and structure
when_to_use_each.string_format: Simple commands without complex arguments or spaces

_tips: Use 'seqr -v' to see detailed execution logs
Background services (keepAlive) will restart if they crash
Press Ctrl+C to stop all processes and exit seqr

commands._comment: String format - simple command, easy to read
commands._why_string: Simple command with no complex arguments - string format is clearest
commands.name: simple-echo

commands._comment: Array format - command with flags, no shell parsing issues
commands._why_array: Flags are explicit as separate array elements
commands.name: list-files

commands._comment: Object format - complex command with many arguments
commands._why_object: Complex Docker command with volume mounts - object format makes structure clear
commands.name: complex-docker

commands._why_array: Python module syntax (-m flag) is clearer as separate arguments
